content: The NU-901 synthesis involves two steps: (1) synthesis of the Zr6 node capped with benzoate ligands and (2) addition of H4TBAPy to a solution containing the node. Synthesis of the node has been reported previously (see the Supporting Information (SI) for details). The purity of the benzoate-capped node was confirmed by comparison of the powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) pattern (Figure S1) with a simulated pattern. A solution of 4 mL of acetic acid in 7 mL of dimethylformamide (DMF) was prepared, of which 10 mL was used to solvate 200 mg of the fully dried Zr6 precursor. Separately, 100 mg of H4TBAPy, synthesized according to the reported procedure, was solvated in 10 mL of DMF. The H4TBAPy solution was added dropwise at room temperature at a rate of 0.05 mL/min to the Zr6 solution with vigorous stirring and left overnight. The slow titration of the linker solution is crucial otherwise an immediate addition leads to a rapid precipitation of the organic linker due to its low solubility in the DMF/acetic acid mixture. The resulting material after slow titration, named NU-901-RT, was washed extensively with DMF to remove excess reagents, solvent-exchanged to acetone, and dried at 120 °C under vacuum.
